title: Leisure Painter - November 2015 (gnv64)
description:
Leisure Painter - November 2015
English | 68 pages | PDF | 16.3 mb

FEATURES
10 Depth in the landscape - Whichever medium you prefer, Christine Pybus takes you through the use of aerial perspective, vanishing points, composition, colour and tone to produce realistic and painterly landscapes
13 Watercolour challenges - Follow David Bellamy as he experiments with the granulating effects of Daniel Smith watercolours. From laying washes to colour mixing, here's how to paint with confidence
16 Painting project - Part 2 Bob Elcock completes his study of a leopard step by step in pastel pencil
20 Tying laces - lucy Swinburne demonstrates the drawing of ballet shoes using graphite pencil
22 Back to basics - Part 3 Blending and texture. How and when to create texture in your pastel paintings with Heather Harman
26 A sense of the seasons - Part 2 Autumn. Use a variety of media and collage to produce warm autumnal stililifes with Wendy Jelbert
28 All about colour - Part 12 How to mix and use interesting greys with Steve Strode
31 How do [ use ... water-mixable oils? Part 2 How to complete a painting, wet on wet in one sitting with Tony Paul
34 Local interest - Part 5 Prepare and use oil pastels over ink drawings with Tim Fisher
37 Go with the flow Follow linda Wain's back-ta-basics approach to using liquid acrylics
40 Small jewels Elena Parashko offers a wealth of coloured perKi' ideas and techniques for drawing small studies
43 Moving to oils - Part 1 Face the challenges of changing your medium in the capable hands of Martin Kinnear
50 Try something different - Giorgio Uccellini offers more hints and tips for the beginner as he takes you through the painting of a chimpanzee using an airbrush
52 Speciality brush report - Tim Fisher puts Jackson's natural hair range of speciality watercolour brushes through its paces

ON THE COVER
Heather Harman Poppy Valley, soft pastel, 14x14in. (35.5x35.5cm). Heather discusses some of the techniques she uses to retain freshness in her pastel paintings

IN EVERY ISSUE
7 Diary - Things to do this month
8 letters - Your tips, comments, ideas and questions
55 Books - Practical art books to read this month
56 Art clubs - News, profiles, exhibition listings and 'best in show' gallery
60 Exhibitions - Some of the best shows around the country
66 Online gallery - Jane Stroud chooses two portraits to profile from PaintersOnline

NEWS, WORKSHOPS & OFFERS
6 Enter this year's charity Christmas card competition
8 Make the most 01 a special ofler from Search Press
48 LP subscriplioo offers this month
62 The latest news from Art Materials Uve
65 Win a painting holiday worth up to Â£750
67 Order your FREE book from Search Press
